page.title: 18Churches of the area.
page.content:
Of the churches in Ingatestone the oldest and most impressive is the parish church of St. Edmund and St. Mary (Church of England). Set slightly back from the High Street, parts date from as early as the late 11th. century. The tower was built of local bricks in the late 15th. century though to most people it appears more modern. Further parts of the church were added in the 16th. and early 17th. centuries and some restoration was carried out in the 19th. century.
Buttsbury and Margaretting churches are two small old churches in isolated locations. Access to Margaretting church is across an unmanned level crossing, there are a few houses nearby but the village it serves (Margaretting) is 1km. to the north and outside the area studied.
